page.title: 05ELMBRIDGE - LISTED BUILDINGS
page.content: There are four listed buildings in the area, BADGE COURT is a fine example of an H plan Manor House of the late 16th century and was restored in 1977. It is two stories high with attics. The timber frame has a lathe and plaster infill. SWALLOW COTTAGE and CLARKES CLOSE are smaller properties, again timber framed but dating from the 17th century. The infill is of brick. Both have one storey with attics which have dormer windows. There are 20th century alterations but where possible old materials have been used. BROAD HOUSE FARM is a brick three storey Georgian style house, dating from the early 19th century with 20th century additions. There is a barn ajoining the house reputed to be 400 years old and being the original house with a pedimented doorcase.
